abstract: Conflict Research Records Center, archive containing captured enemy documents and providing scholars with opportunity to examine inner workings of United States' foes, closes due to lack of Pentagon funding; critics point to center's closing as evidence of flawed national priorities; Pentagon officials say they are planning to transfer archive to civilian institution.
lead_paragraph: The documents included detailed records of Saddam Hussein’s high command in Iraq and Qaeda records from Afghanistan; Pentagon officials say they are planning to transfer the archive to a civilian institution.

headline.main: Archive of Captured Enemy Documents Closes
headline.print_headline: Pentagon Closes Archive of Seized Enemy Papers

snippet: The documents included detailed records of Saddam Hussein’s high command in Iraq and Qaeda records from Afghanistan; Pentagon officials say they are planning to transfer the archive to a civilian institution.

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
